place.name: NANCWNLLE
place.gazetteerText: NANTCWNLLE, a parish in Tregaron district, Cardigan; on the river Ayron, 3¾ miles N N W of Bettws r.station, and 6½ W S W of Tregaron. It contains the villages of Llandainfach and Dalbdwda; and its post town is Tregaron, under. Carmarthen. Acres, 4, 603. Real property, £1,074. Pop., 803. Houses, 174. The property is much subdivided. An ancient camp is at Penygaer. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, not reported. Patron, the Bishop of St. David's. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
